meanings.definition: An excessive or disproportionate size or amount in relation to something else.
meanings.sent1: The overproportions of the giant's feet made him look comical.
meanings.sent2: The overproportions of the cake made it impossible to finish in one sitting.
meanings.sent3: The overproportions of the clown's shoes caused laughter among the children.
meanings.sent4: The overproportions of the mountain cast a shadow over the entire valley.
meanings.sent5: The overproportions of the elephant's ears helped it stay cool in the hot savanna.

meanings.definition: To make something appear larger or more important than it actually is.
meanings.sent1: The artist used clever lighting to overproportions the size of the sculpture.
meanings.sent2: Advertisers often overproportions the benefits of their products in commercials.
meanings.sent3: She playfully overproportions her cat's hunting skills when telling stories.
meanings.sent4: His ego overproportions his actual influence in the company.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks can overproportions the audience's sense of wonder.
